organic_results.title: Intellectual skill and academic performance: Do families bias the relationship?
organic_results.snippet: Using data taken from High School and Beyond, the author explores whether there is bias in the regression of academic performance in high school on intellectual skill that may be due to the exclusion of variables tapping collectively experienced elements of family environment. By applying a latent-variable structural equation model, he demonstrates that the regression of academic performance on intellectual skill is not subject to this type of omitted-variable bias. This finding suggests that any omitted-variable bias in the relationship …

publication_info.summary: JD Teachman - Sociology of Education, 1996 - JSTOR
